main event: A witness reported seeing a faintly luminescent aerial object of elongated or oval shape, about the size of a small automobile, on June 3, 1958, near Bowers, Minnesota.
interesting points: The sighting occurred at night with considerable snow covering the ground., The object passed silently at a low altitude from northwest to southeast., The witness observed the object for about 15 to 20 seconds., The event occurred during a clear and starry night., The report was submitted eight years after the sighting.
witness description: Bernard C. Ruik, who reported the sighting in a handwritten letter.
